app.title: Mining Block Model Generator
app.subtitle: Create dummy 3D block models for testing mining applications

memory.title: Memory Monitor
memory.note: Note: Memory information may not be available in all browsers.

gettingStarted.title: üöÄ Getting Started
gettingStarted.welcome: Welcome to the Mining Block Model Generator! This tool helps you create realistic 3D block models for testing mining applications, visualization, and data analysis. The tool also supports petroleum geology applications through specialized patterns.
gettingStarted.blockModelDesc: A block model is a 3D grid representation of a mining deposit, where each block (cell) contains properties like:
gettingStarted.coordinates: Coordinates (X, Y, Z) - Block center position
gettingStarted.economicValue: Economic Value - Calculated value per block
gettingStarted.step1: Set Model Parameters - Define origin, cell size, and grid dimensions
gettingStarted.step2: Choose a Pattern - Select how materials are distributed (12 patterns available: Uniform, Layered, Ore Bodies, Petroleum, etc.)
gettingStarted.step3: Generate Model - Click "Generate" to create your block model
gettingStarted.step4: Visualize - Explore the 3D model using interactive controls
gettingStarted.step5: Export - Download as CSV for use in other software
gettingStarted.headerButtons: The header contains quick access buttons:
gettingStarted.docsButton: üìö Docs - Opens this documentation (you're reading it now!)
gettingStarted.memoryButton: Memory - Monitor memory usage for large models
gettingStarted.tipStart: üí° Tip: Start with default parameters to get familiar with the tool, then adjust based on your needs.

modelParameters.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Model Parameters
modelParameters.intro: Model parameters define the physical structure and dimensions of your block model.
modelParameters.originDesc: The origin (X, Y, Z) defines the starting point of your model. All block coordinates are calculated relative to this origin.
modelParameters.originXyz: Origin X, Y, Z - Starting coordinates in meters (default: 0, 0, 0)
modelParameters.originUseful: Useful for aligning models with real-world coordinates
modelParameters.cellSizeDesc: Cell size determines the dimensions of each block in the model.
modelParameters.cellSizeXyz: Cell Size X, Y, Z - Block dimensions in meters (default: 1m √ó 1m √ó 1m)
modelParameters.cellSizeDifferent: All three dimensions can be different (e.g., 10m √ó 10m √ó 5m)
modelParameters.gridDimensionsDesc: The number of cells in each direction determines the model size.
modelParameters.cellsXyz: Cells X, Y, Z - Number of blocks in each direction (default: 25 √ó 25 √ó 25)
modelParameters.totalBlocks: Total blocks = Cells X √ó Cells Y √ó Cells Z
modelParameters.largerModels: Larger models take more time to generate and render
modelParameters.performanceNote: ‚ö†Ô∏è Performance Note: Models with more than 50,000 blocks may take longer to generate. The app automatically uses caching for large models.
modelParameters.tipTesting: üí° Tip: For testing, start with smaller models (10√ó10√ó10 = 1,000 blocks). For production, use realistic mining dimensions (e.g., 50√ó50√ó30 = 75,000 blocks).

patterns.title: üé® Material Patterns
patterns.intro: Material patterns control how different materials (ore, waste, etc.) are distributed throughout your block model.
patterns.porphyryDesc: Creates zoned ore bodies with concentric zones. Simulates porphyry copper-gold deposits.
patterns.porphyryFeature1: High-grade core, intermediate shell, low-grade halo
patterns.porphyryFeature2: Different Cu:Au ratios in different zones
patterns.porphyryFeature4: Randomized parameters for variation between generations
patterns.porphyryFeature5: Center position, radii, grades, and structural controls are randomized
patterns.porphyryTip: üí° Tip: Each time you press Generate, the porphyry ore body will have different characteristics while maintaining realistic geological patterns.
patterns.veinDesc: Creates linear or planar ore bodies following structural controls. Simulates epithermal gold, mesothermal veins, or fault-controlled deposits.
patterns.veinFeature2: Grade variations along strike and dip
patterns.veinFeature3: Supports multiple parallel or intersecting veins
patterns.ellipsoidDesc: Creates ellipsoidal ore bodies with plunging structures. Simulates massive sulfide, skarn, or VMS deposits.
patterns.saltDomeDesc: Creates a salt dome structure with oil and gas traps. Demonstrates petroleum geology concepts using the block model framework.
patterns.saltDomeFeature1: Parabolic salt dome structure with cap rock
patterns.saltDomeFeature2: Oil and gas trap zones around the dome
patterns.saltDomeFeature4: Multiple material types: Salt, CapRock, OilSand, GasSand, WaterSand, Shale
patterns.saltDomeFeature5: Randomized dome position, size, trap zones, and material properties
patterns.saltDomeFieldMapping: üí° Field Mapping: For petroleum geology, the standard fields are repurposed:
patterns.saltDomeField4: rockType = Material type (Salt, CapRock, OilSand, GasSand, WaterSand, Shale)
patterns.saltDomeTip: üí° Tip: Each generation produces a different salt dome structure with randomized dimensions, positions, and material properties.
patterns.randomClustersDesc: Creates multiple randomly distributed ore clusters. Simulates disseminated or stockwork deposits.
patterns.inclinedVeinDesc: Creates an inclined planar ore body. Simulates vein deposits or fault-controlled mineralization.
patterns.singleOreHorizonDesc: Creates a single horizontal ore layer at a specific depth. Simulates flat-lying deposits.
patterns.randomDesc: Completely random distribution of materials. Useful for stress testing.
patterns.checkerboardDesc: Alternating pattern of materials. Good for testing filtering and visualization tools.
patterns.gradientDesc: Gradual transition of properties from one side to another. Useful for testing visualization.
patterns.layeredDesc: Creates horizontal layers of different materials. Simulates sedimentary deposits.
patterns.uniformDesc: All blocks have the same material properties. Useful for testing or simple models.

visualization.title: üëÅÔ∏è Visualization
visualization.intro: The 3D visualization allows you to explore your block model interactively.
visualization.solidDesc: Shows blocks as solid cubes. Best for seeing overall structure and material distribution.
visualization.pointsDesc: Shows blocks as individual points. Useful for large models or when you need to see through the model.
visualization.transparentDesc: Shows blocks with transparency. Allows you to see internal structure while maintaining shape.
visualization.squaresDesc: Shows blocks as flat squares. Good for 2D-like visualization or when viewing from above.
visualization.slicesDesc: Shows only blocks in evenly-spaced slice planes along the selected axis. Automatically calculates optimal number of slices (2-5) based on model size. Useful for examining cross-sections and understanding internal structure.
visualization.slicesXDesc: Shows slices perpendicular to X-axis (front/back cross-sections)
visualization.slicesYDesc: Shows slices perpendicular to Y-axis (left/right cross-sections)
visualization.slicesZDesc: Shows slices perpendicular to Z-axis (top/bottom cross-sections)
visualization.slicesNote: Note: Slice view modes automatically skip block thinning for better visualization, even in large models.
visualization.fieldsDesc: Choose which property to visualize using color:
visualization.rockTypeField: Rock Type - Color by material classification
visualization.densityField: Density - Color scale based on density values
visualization.cuGradeField: Cu Grade - Color scale based on copper grade
visualization.auGradeField: Au Grade - Color scale based on gold grade
visualization.valueField: Value - Color scale based on economic value
visualization.tipHover: üí° Tip: Hover over blocks to see detailed information in the tooltip, including coordinates, grades, and other properties.

filters.title: üîç Filters & Tools
filters.intro: Filters and tools help you focus on specific parts of your model or analyze particular features.
filters.sliceToolDesc: The slice tool allows you to view cross-sections of your model by hiding blocks outside a specific plane.
filters.sliceToolFeature1: Enable - Turn the slice tool on/off
filters.sliceToolFeature2: Axis - Choose which axis to slice (X, Y, or Z)
filters.sliceToolFeature3: Position - Adjust the slice position using the slider
filters.valueFilterDesc: Filter blocks based on their economic value or other numeric properties.
filters.valueFilterFeature1: Enable Filter - Turn the filter on/off
filters.valueFilterFeature2: Mode - Show blocks above or below the threshold
filters.valueFilterFeature3: Threshold - Set the value threshold using the slider
filters.valueFilterUseful: Useful for identifying high-value ore zones or filtering out low-value material.
filters.categoryFilterDesc: Show or hide specific categories (e.g., rock types) in your visualization.
filters.categoryFilterFeature1: Enable Filter - Turn the filter on/off
filters.categoryFilterFeature2: Checkboxes - Select which categories to show/hide
filters.categoryFilterNote: Categories are automatically detected from categorical fields like Rock Type.
filters.groundLayerDesc: Display a ground surface plane to provide spatial context.
filters.groundLayerFeature1: Show Ground - Toggle the ground plane visibility
filters.groundLayerUseful: Helpful for understanding the relationship between your model and the surface.

export.title: üíæ Export & Data
export.intro: Export your block model to CSV format for use in other mining software.
export.exportFormatDesc: The exported CSV follows a standardized schema compatible with:
export.exportProcessStep3: The CSV file will download automatically
export.exportProcessStep4: Open in Excel, mining software, or other tools
export.exportedFieldsDesc: The CSV includes all relevant block properties:
export.exportedField1: X, Y, Z - Block centroid coordinates (meters)
export.exportedField2: ROCKTYPE - Rock type classification (or material type for petroleum)
export.exportedField3: DENSITY - Density (tonnes/m¬≥) or Porosity for petroleum patterns
export.exportedField4: GRADE_CU - Copper grade (%) or Oil Saturation for petroleum
export.exportedField5: GRADE_AU - Gold grade (g/t) or Gas Saturation for petroleum
export.exportPetroleumNote: üí° Note: For petroleum geology patterns, field meanings differ. See the Data Schema section for details on petroleum field mappings.
export.exportTip: üí° Tip: The export automatically filters out "air blocks" (blocks with density = 0) to reduce file size and improve compatibility.
export.exportWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: Large models may produce large CSV files. For models with >100,000 blocks, consider using filters before exporting. The export uses chunked processing to handle very large models (200x200x200+) without hitting JavaScript string length limits.

schema.title: üìä Data Schema
schema.intro: The block model uses a standardized schema for maximum compatibility with mining software.
schema.coordConvention1: All coordinates represent block centroids (center points)
schema.coordConvention2: Coordinates are calculated as: centroid = origin + (index + 0.5) √ó cellSize
schema.coordConvention4: Precision: 4 decimal places for numeric values
schema.petroleumMappingsDesc: For petroleum geology patterns (e.g., Salt Dome Reservoir), the standard fields are repurposed to represent petroleum properties:
schema.petroleumMapping6: Salt, CapRock, OilSand, GasSand, WaterSand, Shale
schema.petroleumMappingsNote: üí° Note: This field mapping allows the same block model framework to be used for both mining and petroleum applications. When exporting petroleum models, be aware that field names remain the same but meanings differ.

controls.title: üéÆ Controls
controls.mouseControlRotateDesc: Rotate the 3D model around its center
controls.keyboardDesc: Currently, all controls are mouse-based. Keyboard shortcuts may be added in future versions.
controls.buttonGenerate: Generate - Creates a new block model based on current parameters
controls.buttonExport: Export - Downloads the current model as CSV (enabled after generation)
controls.buttonZoom: Zoom to Fit - Resets the camera to show the entire model
controls.buttonDocs: üìö Docs - Opens this documentation in a new window
controls.buttonAbout: About - Shows application information and credits

tips.title: üí° Tips & Tricks
tips.perfTip1: Start with smaller models to test patterns and settings
tips.perfTip2: Use "Points" view mode for very large models (>100K blocks)
tips.perfTip3: Use "Slices X/Y/Z" view modes for examining large models - automatically skips thinning
tips.perfTip4: Enable filters to reduce rendering load
tips.perfTip5: Large models (>50K blocks) are automatically cached in browser storage for faster regeneration
tips.perfTip6: Models >200K blocks use automatic block thinning for visualization (full model available for export)
tips.perfTip7: Models >500K blocks are generated in chunks to avoid browser freezing
tips.perfTip8: Value filter uses GPU-accelerated shader-based clipping for real-time updates
tips.vizTip1: Use different view modes to see different aspects of your model
tips.vizTip2: Combine slice tool with filters for detailed cross-section analysis
tips.vizTip3: Switch between visualization fields to compare different properties
tips.vizTip4: Use transparent mode to see internal structure
tips.patternTip1: Porphyry-Style Zoning - Ideal for large-scale porphyry deposits
tips.patternTip2: Vein/Structural Ore Body - Best for epithermal gold and fault-controlled deposits
tips.patternTip3: Ellipsoid Ore Body - Best for massive sulfide, skarn, or VMS deposits
tips.patternTip4: Salt Dome Reservoir - Perfect for petroleum geology demonstrations
tips.patternTip5: Random Clusters - Realistic for disseminated or stockwork deposits
tips.patternTip6: Inclined Vein - Good for simple vein deposits
tips.patternTip7: Single Ore Horizon - Good for flat-lying sedimentary deposits
tips.patternTip8: Basic Patterns (Random, Checkerboard, Gradient, Layered, Uniform) - Useful for testing and simple models
tips.exportTip1: Filter out unwanted blocks before exporting to reduce file size
tips.exportTip2: Verify coordinate system matches your target software
tips.exportTip3: Check that all required fields are present for your use case
tips.exportTip4: Use appropriate cell sizes for your application (e.g., 5m√ó5m√ó5m for detailed models)
tips.useCase1Desc: Generate models with known properties to test algorithms, visualization, or processing tools.
tips.useCase2Desc: Create models for teaching mining concepts, visualization techniques, or data analysis.
tips.useCase3Desc: Use generated models as test data during software development when real data isn't available.
tips.useCase4Desc: Test visualization tools with various model sizes, patterns, and properties.
tips.useCase5Desc: Use the Salt Dome Reservoir pattern to demonstrate petroleum geology concepts, reservoir modeling, and oil/gas trap visualization.
tips.proTip: üí° Pro Tip: Save your parameter combinations for common use cases. The app remembers your last settings in the browser.
